potential Module¶

class potential.BasePotential[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for inter-atomic potentials.

Inter-atomic potentials can be described by a scalar function V(r) which depends on the distance r=| r⃗i- r⃗j| between two atoms i and j. In MD simulations we need this potential and the force F⃗(r)=-∇V(r).

evaluate(r)[source]¶

Evaluate potential V(r)

Parameters:r – Inter-atom distance r=|ri-rj|
evaluate_force(rx, ry)[source]¶

Evaluate force.

Calculate the interatomic force F⃗(r)=-∇V(r) for atomic distance :vec{r}=(r_x,r_y)=vec{r}_i - vec{r}_j:

Parameters:
  • rx – x-component of distance rx
  • ry – y-component of distance ry

class potential.LennardJonesShifted(epsilon=1.0, sigma=1.0)¶

Bases: potential.BasePotential

Shifted Lennard Jones potential.

for r>rc=2 1/6 the potential (and force) is set to zero.

Parameters:
  • epsilon – Potential parameter ϵ
  • sigma – Potential parameter σ
